PLEASE NOTE

This questionnaire is intended for persons who came to Saskatchewan before 1914, although information for later years may be included.

If you cannot answer a question, skip it. We realise that any one person will not be able to answer all questions.

Use extra sheets of paper if there is not enough space on the questionnaire.

Your co-operation in answering this questionnaire is greatly appreciated. All questionnaires are preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives.

Services of a Doctor

1. How far were you from the nearest doctor at first? (Explain the circumstances.)

2. Was there one closer as time went by? (Explain the circumstances.)

3. What was your opinion of the competence of the pioneer doctor in your district? (A good physician? Explain why.)

4. Was it customary to go to the same (or family) doctor in all situations, or did it depend on the nature of the illness?

5. Was the doctor consulted at his office or called to your home? (Explain the circumstances.)

6. What conditions were usually treated without reference to a doctor, and which were of a nature that led to consultation?

7. Do you recall how much you paid for doctors' calls or services?

8. Did costs ever deter you from consulting a doctor?

9. Were farm products or other services exchanged for treatment received?

Give examples.

Dr. and never was in hospital until 1959 when I had right leg amputated. Hip

15. What home remedies did you use for various illnesses? (Specify illnesses and the treatment given.)

16. How did you learn of these remedies? (Specify the remedy and state if it was handed down in the family, recommended by a neighbor, etc.) Were any remedies acquired from the Indians or from people of a particular national background? (Use back of page or extra sheets if necessary)
